smells.name: NestedBlockDepth
smells.description: Excessive nesting leads to hidden complexity. Prefer extracting code to make it easier to understand.

instances.message: Function buildComponent is nested too deeply.
Function getHeaderTop is nested too deeply.
Function onActivityResult is nested too deeply.

smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: Class 'AppCompatPreferenceActivity' with '14' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Interface 'BasePreferenceRepository' with '13' functions detected. Defined threshold inside interfaces is set to '11'
Class 'PreferenceRepository' with '23' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'FiltersFragment' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
Class 'MatchesActivity' with '18' functions detected. Defined threshold inside classes is set to '11'
File 'MatchRowDisplayable.kt' with '12' functions detected. Defined threshold inside files is set to '11'

smells.name: ComplexInterface
smells.description: An interface contains too many functions and properties. Large classes tend to handle many things at once. An interface should have one responsibility. Split up large interfaces into smaller ones that are easier to understand.

instances.message: The interface BasePreferenceRepository is too complex. Consider splitting it up.

smells.name: ComplexMethod
smells.description: Prefer splitting up complex methods into smaller, easier to understand methods.

instances.message: The function onBindViewHolder appears to be too complex.
The function apply appears to be too complex.
The function actionFromIntent appears to be too complex.
The function onBindViewHolder appears to be too complex.

smells.name: LongParameterList
smells.description: The more parameters a method has the more complex it is. Long parameter lists are often used to control complex algorithms and violate the Single Responsibility Principle. Prefer methods with short parameter lists.

instances.message: The function buildFilterList has too many parameters. The current threshold is set to 6.

smells.name: MethodOverloading
smells.description: Methods which are overloaded often might be harder to maintain. Furthermore, these methods are tightly coupled. Refactor these methods and try to use optional parameters.

instances.message: This method is overloaded too many times.
This method is overloaded too many times.
This method is overloaded too many times.

smells.name: LabeledExpression
smells.description: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

instances.message: Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.
Expression with labels increase complexity and affect maintainability.

smells.name: StringLiteralDuplication
smells.description: Multiple occurrences of the same string literal within a single file detected.

smells.name: NotImplementedDeclaration
smells.description: The NotImplementedDeclaration should only be used when a method stub is necessary. This defers the development of the functionality of this function. Hence, the NotImplementedDeclaration should only serve as a temporary declaration. Before releasing, this type of declaration should be removed.

instances.message: The NotImplementedDeclaration should only be used when a method stub is necessary. This defers the development of the functionality of this function. smells.description: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

instances.message: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

smells.name: PreferToOverPairSyntax
smells.description: Pair was created using the Pair constructor, using the to syntax is preferred.

instances.message: Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `fixture.matchesListA() to emptyMap()`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `fixture.matchesListB() to emptyMap()`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `fixture.anyMatches() to emptyMap()`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `first to second`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `filterItems to newItems`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `emptyList() to null`
Pair is created by using the pair constructor. This can replaced by `newItems to DiffUtil.calculateDiff(callback, true)`

smells.description: An abstract class is unnecessary and can be refactored. An abstract class should have both abstract and concrete properties or functions. smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

instances.message: This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.

smells.name: DataClassContainsFunctions
smells.description: Data classes should mainly be used to store data and should not have any extra functions. (Compiler will automatically generate equals, toString and hashCode functions)

instances.message: The data class MatchesViewState contains functions which are not registered conversion functions. The offending method is called matchesItemDisplayables

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (matchesDisplayables.isEmpty() && state.teamMatchesLoading) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: matchesDisplayables.isEmpty() && state.teamMatchesLoading
Parentheses in (startTimeInMillis + TimeUnit.MINUTES.toMillis(105)) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: startTimeInMillis + TimeUnit.MINUTES.toMillis(105)

smells.name: FunctionOnlyReturningConstant
smells.description: A function that only returns a constant is misleading. Consider declaring a constant instead

instances.message: getHeaderHeightForLayout is returning a constant. Prefer declaring a constant instead.

smells.name: SerialVersionUIDInSerializableClass
smells.description: A class which implements the Serializable interface does not define a correct serialVersionUID field. The serialVersionUID field should be a constant long value inside a companion object.

instances.message: The class Quintuple implements the Serializable interface and should thus define a serialVersionUID.

smells.name: SpacingBetweenPackageAndImports

There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of ServiceBindingModule.
